title: XOR Operation in an Array - Easy - LeetCode
content:
Given an integer n and an integer start.
Define an array nums where nums[i] = start + 2*i (0-indexed) and n == nums.length.
Return the bitwise XOR of all elements of nums.
 
Example 1:
Input: n = 5, start = 0
Output: 8

title: Pairs of Songs With Total Durations Divisible by 60 - Array - Easy - LeetCode
Partition Array Into Three Parts With Equal Sum - Easy - LeetCode
content:
Given an array A of integers, return true if and only if we can partition the array into three non-empty parts with equal sums.
Formally, we can partition the array if we can find indexes i+1 < j with (A[0] + A[1] + ... + A[i] == A[i+1] + A[i+2] + ... + A[j-1] == A[j] + A[j-1] + ... +

title: Binary Prefix Divisible By 5 - Array - Easy - LeetCode
content:
Given an array A of 0s and 1s, consider N_i: the i-th subarray from A[0] to A[i] interpreted as a binary number (from most-significant-bit to least-significant-bit.)
Return a list of booleans answer, where answer[i] is true if and only if N_i is divisible by 5.

title: Height Checker - Array - Easy - LeetCode
content:
Students are asked to stand in non-decreasing order of heights for an annual photo.
Return the minimum number of students that must move in order for all students to be standing in non-decreasing order of height.

title: Number of Equivalent Domino Pairs - Array - Easy - LeetCode
content:
Given a list of dominoes, dominoes[i] = [a, b] is equivalent to dominoes[j] = [c, d] if and only if either (a==c and b==d), or (a==d and b==c) - that is, one domino can be rotated to be equal to another domino.
Return the number of pairs (i, j) for which 0 <= i < j < dominoes.len

title: Find Words That Can Be Formed by Characters - Array - Easy - LeetCode
content:
You are given an array of strings words and a string chars.
